teams.name: The Redwoods Group
teams.loan_because: We strongly believe that business can and should be a powerful force for positive social change.  Our mission is to protect and improve the quality of life in the communities we serve and around the globe.
teams.description:
In addition to its other community involvement, Redwoods sets aside $25k each year for we employees to give away.  In 2007 we began using some of that money to make Kiva loans.

Individual employees also contribute.

teams.name: Ukulele Players United to decrease World Suck
teams.loan_because: We Care
teams.description: Ukulele Players united.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Kiva Stories
teams.loan_because: we made a personal connection to a Kiva borrower
teams.description: Kiva's mission is to connect people through lending to alleviate poverty. This team is a celebration of those personal connections and an opportunity for people to share their stories about what made them lend to individuals all around the world.

teams.name: New York
teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.
teams.description:
We are a group of like minded New Yorkers who connect to make a difference.

Please note, Team Message unrelated to Kiva New York team lending & activities may be deleted.  Please keep posts related to the team!

http://gplus.to/kivany

teams.name: The Partner Marketing Group
teams.loan_because: Over the last several years, we've had a fabulous growth opportunity at The Partner Marketing Group and are fortunate enough to be able to share that opportunity with others who need a hand.
teams.description: The Partner Marketing Group is a marketing consulting organization dedicated to helping our clients grow their marketing strategies.

teams.name: Team USA
teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

teams.name: Ghanaians Abroad
teams.loan_because: We want to collectively pitch-in to help the less fortunate develop themselves.
teams.description: A collection of individuals of Ghanaian decent living abroad.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: Kiva San Francisco
teams.loan_because: a little goes a long way.

teams.name: Ravelry.com
teams.loan_because: We want to support crafts people all over the world.
teams.description: We are a group of knitters and crocheters that want to support other crafts people around the world

teams.name: KivaFriends.org
teams.loan_because: we are a diverse group of people with diverse reasons for participating on Kiva.org, but with a unifying desire to alleviate poverty around the world through making microloans to the hard working poor.
teams.description: We are a community for lenders by lenders. We welcome Kiva.org lenders to participate in our lender forums at KivaFriends.org

teams.name: Three Cups of Tea - CAI Supporters
teams.loan_because: we have been touched, moved, inspired, and motivated by the example of Greg Mortenson, humanitarian, peace-maker, and author of "Three Cups of Tea: One Man's Mission To Promote Peace... One School At A Time."  Please read it if you have not already done so: your life will be changed.  We also support the Central Asia Institute (CAI), and Pennies For Peace (www.penniesforpeace.org)
teams.description: We lend especially to women in Pakistan and Afghanistan, where Mortenson and CAI are active in establishing community schools in rural areas.

teams.name: Friends of Pearl Microfinance Limited
teams.whereabouts: Anywhere that supports the entrepreneurs in Uganda!
teams.loan_because: Pearl Microfinance Limited is an organization worth loaning to!

teams.name: Happy Kiva Lenders
teams.description:
We Happy Kiva Lenders think Kiva is great and are happy to see Kiva lending to everyone including US citizens.  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
People in need are people in need regardless of where they live.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Our Goal is to show our support for Kiva's decision to fight poverty everywhere!
Please join us Happy Kiva Lenders and showing your support for Kiva by lending to whomever you want! 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

 You can help in 3 ways - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   
1) Join this team! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2) Make a loan!  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
3) Share this page with your friends! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - -  

 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Through our numbers and our loans we'll let Kiva know that they have our support in fighting poverty everywhere!

teams.name: Etsy.com Handmade
teams.loan_because: we care.  We loan because we can.  We loan because we want to help other micro-entrepreneurs & because so many of us understand the struggles one must face when trying to get a small business off the ground.
teams.description: This group is for buyers, sellers, friends and fans of Etsy.com, the online marketplace for all things handmade.  We love art, crafts, design and DIY!  PLEASE NOTE: we are not sponsored by or endorsed by the staff or owners of Etsy.com.  Just enthusiast fans of the site!

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: { Kiva Fellows & Alumni }
teams.loan_because: We have been to the field and have seen Kiva work firsthand.
teams.description: Kiva Fellows are volunteers who work for Kiva and the field partners and serve as the glue that makes Kiva's model work.

teams.name: Team Liberia
teams.loan_because: We want to help nurture entrepreneurship through microfinance and bring greater prosperity to a peaceful Liberia.
teams.description: This team supports Liberians who are recipients of microloans made in order to help them grow small businesses so that they may earn a dignified and adequate living.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: Friends of Urwego Opportunity Bank of Rwanda
teams.loan_because: We want to support the work of the Urwego Opportunity Bank of Rwanda.
teams.description: Loosely translated from Kinyarwanda, urwego means ladder, and UOB helps Rwanda's working poor climb the ladder of economic empowerment. We are fans of UOB and want to support their great work reaching out to entrepreneurs throughout Rwanda!

teams.name: Vision Finance Company Supporters
teams.loan_because: We support the mission of Vision Finance Company (VFC), a partner of World Vision International.  VFC targets the productive poor, typically women, in rural areas to create holistic change for entire families.
teams.description: Vision Finance Company was Kiva's first partner in Rwanda.  Members of this team support VFC and Rwandese microentrepreneurs.  We believe in the positive change that microfinance has brought about and will bring about in this country.  We support VFC's clients and Rwanda's economic development at a grassroots level.  This country is on the rise and we support the positive change that we see.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: US Military Servicemen and Veterans
teams.loan_because: We know that the the power of American servicemen is not only in their military prowess...but in the generosity and freedom that we personify.
teams.description: The generous warriors of today and the wise veterans of yesterday. Promoting American freedom, ideals and security through the advancement of economic growth and prosperity.

teams.name: Stuff You Should Know from HowStuffWorks.com
teams.loan_because: We care.
teams.description: Arguably the finest assemblage of people who have never met dedicated to the common purpose of hastening global peace in $25 increments.

teams.name: Diamondzeta & Memoreks
teams.loan_because: we are lucky enough to never have to worry about the things these people have to.
teams.description: A small family hoping to make some dreams come true.

teams.name: Dragonfly
teams.loan_because: we believe this is a sustainable model for the future by helping others to help themselves.

teams.name: TEDxNSW
teams.description: TEDxNSW is a group made up of attendees at TEDxNSW, an independently organised TED Talks event held in September 2009.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Belgium
teams.loan_because: Its a nice way to help the beneficiaries of the loans create their own business and hopefully improve their lives.
teams.description: Team of the Belgian citizens & residents and of the fans of Belgian Waffles, Chocolate & Beers !

teams.name: Webcomics
teams.loan_because: Many of us are small business owners, and we would like to support other entrepreneurs in less fortunate situations.
teams.description: Our team is made up of webcomic creators and readers.

teams.name: Kennesaw State University
teams.loan_because: In support of the Millennium Development Goals
teams.description: Students, staff and faculty at Georgia's third largest University.  Currently supported primarily by the KSU Students in Free Enterprise Team.

teams.name: New York
teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.
teams.description:
We are a group of like minded New Yorkers who connect to make a difference.

Please note, Team Message unrelated to Kiva New York team lending & activities may be deleted.  Please keep posts related to the team!

http://gplus.to/kivany

teams.name: 101 Cookbooks
teams.loan_because: There were nearly a million visits to 101 Cookbooks last month - a statistic that continues to amaze me. As the site has grown over the years, I kept thinking to myself that it would be great to figure out a way for us to affect change as a group - Kiva (with its team lending) is a great way for us to do that.
teams.description: Readers of Heidi Swanson's online recipe journal (blog) 101cookbooks.com

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: Colbert Nation
teams.loan_because: I am helping my fellow wealthy American friends lighten their swollen pockets to help the rest of the world prosper.
teams.description: Stephen Colbert is the host and executive producer of the Emmy-nominated series on Comedy Central, "The Colbert Report." Touted by the New York Times as "one of the best television shows of the year" and praised as "a must-watch show" by Entertainment Weekly, "The Colbert Report" has garnered ratings and critical success as one of the top shows on television.

teams.name: Team Minneapolis/St. Paul
teams.loan_because: We want to make a difference in the lives of those in need.
teams.description: We are a team of Twin Cities residents concerned about world poverty. We host events around the city to raise money for Kiva loans, which we use to make new loans once the money is returned. We hope, as a community, to improve the plight of the impoverished by using microlending.

teams.description:

teams.name: Norway
teams.loan_because:
We have Cold Weather - Warm hearts !
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.
teams.description:
Bruk denne linken for å invitere dine venner til teamet her:
http://www.kiva.org/team/norway/recruit

Det er flott hvis du trykker Facebook "anbefale/recommend" knappen oppe til høyre  på denne siden. Vår facebookgruppe: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kiva-Norway/193432017389484

Anbefalte lån "sikrere" lån: 
http://www.kiva.org/lend?sortBy=partner_default_min=0&partner_default_max=0.5&partner_risk_rating_min=1&partner_risk_rating_max=5&partner_arrears_min=0&partner_arrears_max=1.1&sortBy=repaymentTerm
Hjelp med "expiring loans": http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans/#fundraising_loans

Hjelp med "postdisbursed" lån:
http://kivatools.com/fundraising/postdisbursedloans

Kiva tools:
https://www.kiva.org/portfolio/collections
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kiva-country-collector/
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kfpc/
http://www.kivalens.org

Da har vi nådd målet på 2 million dollar utlånt. Takk til alle som har bidratt!

teams.loan_because: We want to do our part to help circulate a momentum of opportunity.  We want to help people trying to help themselves and support striving people so that they may have access to manifesting their ideas.
teams.description: We are a group of thankful people.  Some of the group members notice the mystical number 11 often.  ;-)

teams.name: Team Virginia
teams.loan_because: We give new meaning to the phrase "Commonwealth of Virginia."  We Virginians are thrilled to pool our common resources to help entrepreneurs all over the world as they improve their lives and their communities.
teams.description:
From the Appalachian Mountains to Virginia Beach (and equally welcoming of members outside the state), we are enthusiastic Kiva lenders privileged to have ties to the great state of Virginia. 
( Photo Copyright 2007 D L Ennis all rights reserved http://dlennis.wordpress.com )

teams.name: Psychologists for peace
teams.loan_because: Research shows that poverty is a major cause of distress and conflict around the world.  Loaning on Kiva allows us to play a small role in promoting peace through the alleviation of poverty.
teams.description: We are an international network of psychologists and related professionals who are interested in promoting peace in the world.  Many of us are also interested in supporting entrepreneurs who have been touched by mental illness and/or entrepreneurs working to provide mental health services in their community.

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: New York
teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.
teams.description:

Please note, Team Message unrelated to Kiva New York team lending & activities may be deleted.  Please keep posts related to the team!

http://gplus.to/kivany

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Intel Small Things Challenge
teams.loan_because: Every small, individual action can make a big difference -- especially if millions participate. A modest micro-loan will give an entrepreneur a hand-up to start a new business and provide for his or her family.
teams.description:
Intel is the corporate sponsor of the Small Things Challenge. The company is providing financial support as well as providing opportunities throughout the year to increase global awareness for the issues addressed by the Small Things Challenge – providing opportunities so children in developing countries can attend primary school and their parents can earn higher incomes.
The Intel Small Things Challenge builds upon Intel’s 40 years of active involvement in education. The company is again investing about $100 million in education in 2009. Over the last decade, Intel has invested over $1 billion and Intel employees have donated more than 2 million hours towards improving education in 50 countries.  
Individuals can provide support and find more information about the Small Things Challenge – including the online petition and a video featuring musicians and actors who support the cause – at www.smallthingschallenge.com.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Christians Against Abortion
teams.loan_because: We want to be obedient to Jesus Christ: 'But love your enemies, do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return; and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High...' Luke 6:35
teams.description:
A group of believers in Jesus Christ, ready to sacrifice to follow Him.    

---- (1) We are committed to defending the unborn.   

The words of Jesus speak strongly to us in the present situation: 
'And when Jesus saw it, he was angry, and said to them, Let the little children come to me, and do not keep them away; for of such is the kingdom of God.' Mark 10:14 
'Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me.' Luke 9:48

---- (2) We are motivated by the biblical call to equality: 'For I do not mean that others should be eased and you burdened; but at the present time your abundance should supply their need, so that their abundance may supply your need, that there may be equality.' 2 Corinthians 8:13-14

---- (3) We want to build this team of like-minded people as a place of encouragement and care. 

Join, if you believe in all the words of Jesus.

teams.name: Kiva Flash Mob
teams.loan_because:
we want to bring lenders from different teams together and show some Kiva love to loans have so far been overlooked. We want to help get them funded by organizing a Flash Mob to these loans.  

The effect of many lenders loaning to the same loan at the same time is that the loan will show up on page 1 of the popularity sort, which is the default page that most lenders look at when they come to Kiva. So besides the loans from the Flash Mob team, Flash Mob loans often attract many additional loans from other lenders who just happened to log into Kiva at this time. Sometimes a loan gets completely funded within the hour!

Feel free to keep attributing your loans to your favorite team, it is fun to see many different team logos on the same loan.
teams.description:
Primary Flash Mob time is 9am US West Coast / noon EST / 6pm MET / 4am AET

If you can't join the primary Flash Mob, a second Flash Mob time is 11pm US West Coast / 2am EST / 8am MET / 6pm AET

The loan will be posted an hour or two in advance to give you time to research it. For maximum Flash Mob impact, please try to loan exactly at Flash Mob time.

For email alerts with just the daily loan link, please join http://www.kiva.org/team/KFM_messages and set your email preferences for that team to immediate delivery. For a comprehensive description of the Flash Mob loan, to talk to other Flash Mobbers and to suggest loans, please join this team. 

Loans selected for the Flash Mob are typically within 2 weeks of expiration (preferably red-boxed) and completely unfunded or lacking a substantial amount. For suggestions please message the captains.

teams.name: Indiana
teams.loan_because: We believe people around the world are connected and we can make a positive difference in others' lives.
teams.description:
Indiana is the 19th U.S. state and is located in the Midwest region of the United States of America. With over six million residents, it is ranked 15th in population and 17th in population density.

Indiana is a diverse state with a few large urban areas and a number of smaller industrial cities. It is best known for the Indianapolis 500 American automobile race, held annually over the Memorial Day weekend, and a strong basketball tradition, often called Hoosier Hysteria. Residents of Indiana are called Hoosiers. The state's name means "Land of the Indians."

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world: 
http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=indiana

To see a map showing where Indiana team members are located, click the link below.

teams.name: LOGIN
teams.loan_because:
I am  asking all my  friends to join team LOGIN  and make a $25 loan. 
You pick who you lend too and once the loan is paid back you can re lend by picking someone new to lend too or you can  choose to   get your loan back! 
When making your loan please click the drop down box (count for, team LOGIN) so we can track how much we have loaned as a group!


Team selection happens early in the process, it’s easy to overlook. 
Let the lending begin! 
Cynthia
teams.description:
Entrepreneurs helping Entrepreneurs because we can!  
Thanks  to Kiva for making it possible and for making it so easy!

teams.name: Late Loaning Lenders
teams.loan_because:
We hate to see loans being left unfunded on 
Kiva. Although most of these loans are 
pre-funded by the Field Partners, the Field
Partners lose out on the capital if a loan
doesn't get funded on Kiva. We believe that 
this will damage the Field Partners in the long 
term and impair their capacity to make loans to new borrowers.

We can't save every red loan, but we try to
make a difference as in the Starfish Story:
http://67.199.70.191/articles/the-starfish-story.aspx
Help us fund loans we're already supporting:
http://www.kiva.org/team/late_loaning_lenders/loans?status=fundRaising


Check out Charlotte's Web: http://starfish.dynalias.org

This watchlist for loans suggested by the team members (starfish + offlist) shows:
* the current position in the popularity ranking (considering pages 1 to 5)
* the timestamp of the most recent loan
* the basket amount
Click magnifier icon for more info.  Or read Charlotte’s post at @Charlotte re: #346848
Also known as "CW," or "Charlotte's Web of Wonders"


We invite you to join us and make a difference, too. Please check the team board at 2 am Kiva time, 7 am Kiva time, 1 pm Kiva time and 6 pm Kiva time to coordinate lending.

See our team fund page:
http://www.kiva.org/lender/kivalllfund
teams.description:
Alan's account of the founding of LLL is on the  team board @Alan re: #260143. Loans that are nearing expiry won't get funded if they don't get noticed. We look for loans that are about to expire by using the Sort By:
"Expiring Soon" option instead of the default "Popularity", and then work to get them funded.

See our team FAQ, linked above (the "Team Website" button, next to our traffic light avatar).

A Team LLL glossary (contributed by team member Tony):

Red Loans: Loans that have less than five days to be funded, identifiable by the red box with the notice that says "Only x days left!" or 
"Only x hours and y minutes left!"

LLL - Late Loaning Lenders: this team, where 
lenders work together to keep loans from 
expiring.

SFDD - Starfish Daily Dozen: Under current 
practice, one of these lists is prepared and 
posted for each day, to help LLL lenders focus 
and coordinate their lending on a targeted 
group of loans (the Starfish or SF). The lists 
are prepared by a group of volunteers who 
seek to be objective in selecting the loans to 
be included in their lists. They also seek to 
spread out the loans in each list over a 24 hour 
period and to share the joy among the Field 
Partners with loans expiring during that period, 
but their efforts are always constrained by the 
choice of loans that are available for inclusion 
in the list. Loans with larger amounts needed 
will be included in the period immediately after 
each Credit Day, when lenders are feeling 
flush, but the lists will become less ambitious 
when the LLL lenders are feeling poor.

GG - Gorgeous Group: The SFDD list-makers usually add one or two of these loans at the end of the SF daily dozen lists. As the name 
implies, only group loans are picked. When it is 
first posted, a typical GG loan will expire two 
days or more after the list is posted. It will 
usually be retained as a GG until it becomes 
Fully Funded or moves into Starfish range. The amount needed when the loan is selected as a GG will vary depending on the time of month.

OPM - Abbreviation for "other people's money."  Our main lending method is to coordinate LLL team members' loans, so that we make several loans to a borrower within a short period of time. This will move the borrower's loan request up in Kiva's "popularity" sort and get the loan noticed by other people (non-members of the LLL team).  Many loans then get their funding completed by loans from those non-LLL members.  By attracting other lenders' attention to our Starfish loans in this way, we multiply the impact of our finite funds, and save more loans from expiring than we otherwise could.

RTR - Reduce the Red: These lists are 
prepared and posted when there are large 
numbers of loans slated to expire in a short 
period of time. "Red" is a reference to the red 
boxes that are added to a loan description 
when the Loan is about to expire without full 
funding.

Bulge: A short period in which a great many loans have their scheduled funding expiration times. This may happen when, for example, the volunteer coordinators at Kiva offer a promo of some kind to the editors & translators, to get them to do a lot of work in a very short period of time. Bulge loans are prime candidates for inclusion in Reduce the Red lists.

BTB - Battling the Boxes: On those days where 
there aren't 12 loans that qualify as "Starfish," the listmakers will include loans that have their red boxes, but more than 24 hours left before their deadline, to make up the 12 loans for the list. The criteria are similar to SF 
loans, i.e., one per field partner and reasonable 
amounts left to fund (not too much; not too 
little), except that these loans may have a longer time left before their expiry date. If they gain good traction on their first BTB day, they may be carried forward. If not ... they stand a second chance as SF.

FF - Fully Funded: This is LLL code for a loan 
that has received all the loans required for it to be removed from the list of loans that are raising funds 
and to move into paying back status.

Lars Ratio: the average funding per hour that is needed for a loan to become fully funded.
(Developed by team member Lars)

Wiedergänger (contributed by Maria) - German expression, literal translation "again walker," meaning "undead," i.e. a person that has died but comes back, aka a zombie. Here it means a loan that disappears from the page, but comes back again because somebody didn't check out their basket.

Ruma sana (contributed by Jouko and Potkukelkka) - Finnish expression, literal translation "ugly words."  It is a phrase to use when you are very frustrated, but want to stop just short of actual cursing -- for example, when the Kiva site repeatedly logs you out when you are trying to rescue an expiring loan at the last second.

See data about all loans currently fundraising on Kiva:
www.kivatools.com
See data about loans that have been mentioned on the LLL board, including the most recent lending activity on each loan:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/
See loans in real time, as they are made:
http://www.http://kivalive.com/index2.php
See "the fireworks" when lending is very fast:
http://www.kiva.org/live

Lists are posted on the LLL Team message 
board. Join us!

teams.name: Remembering Laurie
teams.loan_because: We remember our KivaFriend Laurie with fondness and want to continue lending in her memory.
teams.description: Our friend Laurie Sutherland passed away unexpectedly on Sept 4, 2012. We remember her generous, giving spirit and her joy in life. (If you click on the quilt square she made, you'll see in the larger picture the smile on the woman *and* the sheep.) She was a very early Kiva lender, and most of her loans were made to borrowers who were involved in food production, mostly in Peru or Tajikistan. We will lend similarly, and in her memory. Rest in peace, Laurie.

teams.name: DeutscheBank
teams.loan_because:
Each of us has the ability to help address poverty in a meaningful way and collectively we can positively impact social change.

Deutsche Bank has partnered with Kiva to provide US employees the opportunity to make loans to entrepreneurs of their choice. This capital will help borrowers improve their own lives and create sustainable income to support their families and their communities.

With full participation from our franchise, employees have the potential to impact more than 500,000 people in the developing world.
teams.description: For more than 20 years, Deutsche Bank has been a leader and trusted partner in the field of social finance. Leveraging its core capabilities as a global financial services firm, the Bank has financed opportunities to serve the poor ranging from affordable housing and microfinance to clean energy and healthcare. This collective work represents more than USD 2.5 billion in capital deployed. Deutsche Bank’s Global Social Investments group has relationships with over 120 microfinance institutions (MFIs) in 50 countries around the world. The Bank is committed to complying with laws prohibiting discrimination in lending.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Friends of WSDS in Northeast India
teams.description: This team supports the great work of WSDS-Initiate, which is an inclusive nonprofit that works with women across all tribes and minority communities in Manipur, located in the remote northeast region of India.  They have close ties with community leaders, in various tribes and regions and aligns their work with the needs of the communities, therefore going into isolated hill regions where other forms of capital are not available.   They lend to women over the age of 55, which is unusual for microlending organizations in India.   They provide clients with loans to purchase solar lamps, which is especially impactful because most of the areas WSDS works in do not have electricity. Political unrest and frequent economic blockades in the area make it very difficult to provide services, resulting in Manipur having the lowest penetration of financial services in the country.

teams.name: Portugal
teams.loan_because:
Honramos o legado deixado pelos nossos antepassados que espalharam cultura, conhecimento e valores por todo o mundo. Onde há um português, há um amigo pronto a ajudar e dar esperança aos que mais precisam. Isto é Portugal.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
We honor the legacy of our ancestors who spread our culture, knowledge and values around the world. Wherever there is a Portuguese, there is a friend willing to help and give hope to those in need. This is Portugal.
teams.description: Portuguese Lenders Team

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

teams.loan_because: It's important to try to make a difference when and where you can.

teams.name: Chrome Divas
teams.loan_because: Our goal to offer all women motorcycle enthusiasts the opportunity to ride together and to reach out  to the community throught raising funds for people in need. We hope this team will unite all Chrome Divas across North America and the world. We can extend our helping hands to others in need.
teams.description: Through the diverse sisterhood of the Chrome Divas, our mission is to build a positive image of women motorcyclists and enthusiasts; promote motorcycle safety; elevate consciousness of automobile drivers; create awareness of women and children's issues while giving back to our communities but most importantly, to ride and have fun!
